DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study evaluate efficacy safety JNS013 single oral dose administration participant pain tooth-extraction mandibular impact wisdom tooth .
DOC.brief_title: A Comparative Study JNS013 Participants With Post-Tooth-Extraction Pain
DOC.detailed_description: This multi-center ( conducted one center ) , double-blind ( neither Physician participant know name assigned drug ) , randomize ( study drug assign chance ) , parallel-group ( group participant treat time ) comparative study participant pain intensity least 50.0 millimeter ( mm ) ( visual analog scale , score range 0 mm [ pain ] 100 mm [ worst possible pain ] ) , follow extraction impact mandibular wisdom tooth . The study consist 3 part : Pre-observation ( 7 day study commences Day 1 ) ; Treatment ( Day 1 , consist single oral dose either tramadol plus acetaminophen placebo ; tramadol placebo ; acetaminophen placebo ) Follow-up ( Day 2 8 ) . All eligible participant randomly assign 1 3 study treatment . Efficacy participant primarily evaluate total pain relief , evaluate numerical rating scale . Participants ' safety monitor throughout study .
DOC.criteria: Participants plan receive tooth extraction one mandibular impact wisdom tooth Participants require bone removal separation crown tooth extraction Participants whose intensity pain associate tooth extraction within 2 hour tooth extraction great equal 50.0 millimeter visual analog scale ( VAS ) Participants undergo general anesthesia sedation tooth extraction Participants without abnormality ( include laboratory test value ) correspond Grade 3 `` Criteria severity classification adverse drug reaction '' pretreatment observation period Participants condition tramadol contraindicate Participants condition acetaminophen contraindicate Participants history convulsion possibility convulsive seizure Pregnant participant may pregnant , lactate mother , wish pregnancy study period Participants concurrent , previous , possible alcohol dependence , drug dependence narcotic addiction
